DOC.brief_summary: To compare two lipid emulsion long-term parenteral alimentation patient AIDS relation : Clinical effectiveness . Effect immunologic function . Effect HIV load measure p24 antigen level . Effect relative HIV infectivity .
DOC.brief_title: Long-Term Nutritional Support Patients With Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome : Comparison Liposyn III 2 Percent With Liposyn II 20 Percent
DOC.mesh_term: Safflower oil , soybean oil , phospholipid emulsion
Safflower oil , soybean oil , lecithin emulsion
DOC.criteria: Inclusion Criteria Concurrent Medication : Allowed : Zidovudine ( AZT ) . All drug use standard treatment opportunistic infection . Other drug use treatment AIDS condition start 3 month prior study entry . Patients must : Diagnosis AIDS . Weight loss > 10 percent premorbid body weight . Presenting diagnosis either opportunistic infection Kaposi 's sarcoma . Require home total parenteral nutrition ( TPN ) period approximately 3 month . Life expectancy = > 90 day . Prior Medication : Allowed : Zidovudine ( AZT ) . Exclusion Criteria Coexisting Condition : Patients follow condition symptom exclude : Life expectancy < 90 day . Biliary stasis . History drug abuse . Patients follow exclude : Life expectancy < 90 day . Biliary stasis . History drug abuse . Prior Medication : Excluded within 3 month study entry : Immunomodulators . Experimental antiviral DT . History drug abuse .
